00001 /***********************************************
00002 File : DynamicTypeElement.h
00003 *************************************************/
00004 
00005 #pragma once
00006 
00007 #include <list>
00008 #include <string>
00009 
00010 
00011 namespace PDI
00012 {
00013 
00014 struct DynamicTypeEntry {
00015    std::string first;
00016    std::string second;
00017 };
00018 
00019 /***********************************************
00020  The DynamicTypeElement class holds one "dynamictype" read in from a PDI file.
00021  An example dynamictype in PDI file format follows:
00022  dynamictype BODY {
00023     1 &ACK,
00024     2 &INIT
00025  }
00026  where BODY is stored in the Name field in the DynamicTypeElement class
00027  and 1 &ACK is one entry in the DynamicTypeList.  Each entry is 
00028  stored in a DynamicTypeEntry object, which is just a struct with
00029  two std::string fields.  The first field is a string instead of
00030  an unsigned int, in order to make the definition more flexible.
00031 
00032  m_DynamicTypeList is defined as std::list<DynamicTypeEntry>
00033  Originally we planned to use std::map<std::string, std::string>,
00034  but then realized that when we were going to access the data, 
00035  we just want to iterate over every item in the list, rather than 
00036  look-up an item by passing in the first value.
00037 *************************************************/
00038 class DynamicTypeElement
00039 {
00040 public:
00041    /**** 
00042    The DynamicTypeElement function is just a simple constructor.
00043    *****/
00044    DynamicTypeElement();
00045 
00046    /**** 
00047    The DynamicTypeElement function with one DynamicTypeElement 
00048    parameter is just a simple copy constructor.
00049    *****/
00050    DynamicTypeElement(const DynamicTypeElement& dyn_element);
00051 
00052    /**** 
00053    * The ~DynamicTypeElement function is just a simple destructor.
00054    *****/
00055    ~DynamicTypeElement();
00056 
00057    /**** 
00058    The SetName function is used to set the m_sName member variable
00059    with the name of the dynamictype from the PDI File.  This 
00060    corresponds to the "BODY" string in our example.
00061      ***/
00062    void SetName(const std::string& nameIn);
00063    /*** 
00064    The Name function returns a std::string containing the value
00065    of the m_sName member variable.
00066      ***/
00067    const std::string& Name() const;
00068 
00069    typedef std::list<DynamicTypeEntry> DynamicTypeList;
00070    typedef DynamicTypeList::iterator iterator;
00071    typedef DynamicTypeList::const_iterator const_iterator;
00072    iterator Begin();
00073    iterator End();
00074    const_iterator Begin() const;
00075    const_iterator End() const;
00076 
00077    /*** 
00078    The Insert function is used to insert a DynamicTypeEntry into
00079    a DynamicTypeElement.  There will be one call to the insert
00080    function for each row inside a dynamictype found in the PDI File.
00081      ***/
00082    iterator Insert(const DynamicTypeEntry& entry);
00083 
00084    /*** 
00085    The Clear function is used to empty the DynamicTypeElement list.
00086      ***/
00087    void Clear();
00088 
00089 protected:
00090 
00091 
00092 private:
00093    std::string m_sName;
00094    DynamicTypeList m_DynamicTypeList;
00095 };
00096 
00097 } // End namespace
